about_the_game:
WHAT is a Situation Puzzle?

Situation Puzzle, also known as Lateral Thinking Puzzle, is a game where the storyteller, referred to as the host, narrates a seemingly illogical story. Players then ask questions to uncover the truth. Typically, the host will simply respond with 'Yes', 'No' or 'Irrelevant'. Players can use these answers to their questions to deduce the direction of the truth and ultimately uncover the entire story.

WHAT is the story about?

Awoken on an island stranded amidst nowhere, you are left with no recollection of neither your past nor your future; just the face of first person you met on the island, and her lingering question: “Have you heard of anything about Situation Puzzle?”

WHAT are waiting for you?

■ 64 engaging Puzzle Stories, with 2 extra chapters, encompassing a variety of themes such as dark, cozy, humorous, and supernatural Puzzles, topped off with an ironed-out storyline entailing 3 endings to offer a rich taste to your experience.

■ A small, albeit fully-voiced cast and story, recreating the feeling of traditional Visual Novels.

■ A workshop section of your own, where you can try puzzles created by others in the community, or let your mind thrive and make your own puzzle using the built-in editor.

■ A compendium of side events, backgrounds, CGs, collectibles and dialogue diary to ensure fulfillment and clarity after every playthroughs.
■ Original Soundtracks composed by the team.

HOW would you enjoy the Puzzles?

The core loop is incredibly simple: Read the Puzzle → Question Key Words → Find out the truth.

Not certain about the truth of the story? Why not ask One More Question!

Unleash your creativity in Steam Workshop!

■ You can write and upload Puzzle Stories for other players using the built-in editor.

■ You can play Puzzle Stories created by other players.
detailed_description:
Steam Workshop supported

No programming skill required. Players can create their own levels and share them with others by built-in editor.

short_description: A game utilizing the concept of “Situation Puzzles”, One More Question gives a new perspective on familiar quizzes, presents a backdrop and story to immerse yourself in, and give a workshop editor of your own to share your own puzzles with others. Enjoy!
